description: Retention of two storey modular building which houses the Marketing Suite and project office for associated with the redevelopment of the Former Nestle Factory Site, for 3 years, including the retention of the temporary car parking spaces and associated hard and soft landscaping approved under planning permission ref. 1331/APP/2018/3729.(AMENDED PLANS 27/01/23)
decision_conditions: The temporary building and use as marketing suite along with 4 car parking spaces provided in accordance with this permission shall be removed by 15 February 2026, and the land shall be restored as part of the overall landscaping scheme to Wallis Gardens within one month of the removal of the temporary building and car parking spaces.
REASON

To ensure that the temporary building is removed in order to protect the character and appearance of the Conservation Area in accordance with the provisions Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two  : Development Management Policies (2020) and the London Plan (2021)
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans, numbers
FNF-BOSK-90-MS-ZZ-DR-1000-P05
FNF-A-D-MKWR-DR-01-001
HAYESMARKETING SUITE DAS MAY 2022 - PRE APP_REV5
FNF-A-D-MKWR-DR-02-036 Rev B
FNF-C-MS-HYD-DR-01-200 Rev T3
FNF-C-SITE-HYD-DR-04-0240 Rev P2
FNF-S-SITE-GCE-DR-12-1000 Rev T2
182142-Barratt-Hayes,Nestle MS Cabin,dated 28.6.19
Norclad Thermowood data
and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
REASON
To ensure the development complies with the provisions of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012), Part 2 (2020) and the London Plan (2021).

The building hereby approved shall only be used for the purposes stated on the application form and approved drawings, as a temporary marketing suite and shall not be used or be permanently occupied as a separate unit of accommodation.
REASON

To avoid any future fragmentation of the site or the creation of a separate residential use, so as to protect the amenity of adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy BE13, BE15 and BE19 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Saved UDP Policies (November 2012).
The premises shall not be used except between:-
0700 to 1800 Mondays - Fridays
1000 to 1800 Saturdays
1000 to 1800 Sundays, Public or Bank Holidays.
REASON
To safeguard the residential amenity of the occupiers of adjoining and nearby properties in accordance with policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

Trees, hedges and shrubs shown to be retained on the approved plan shall not be damaged, uprooted, felled, lopped or topped without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority. If any retained tree, hedge or shrub is removed or severely damaged during construction, or is found to be seriously diseased or dying another tree, hedge or shrub shall be planted at the same place or, if planting in the same place would leave the new tree, hedge or shrub susceptible to disease, then the planting should be in a position to be first agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority and shall be of a size and species to be agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority and shall be planted in the first planting season following the completion of the development or the occupation of the buildings, whichever is the earlier. Where damage is less severe, a schedule of remedial works necessary to ameliorate the effect of damage by tree surgery, feeding or groundwork shall be agreed
The temporary building shall be used solely as a E (g) (i) use class only.
REASON

To ensure that the use is carried out and maintained as approved in the interest of safeguarding the amenities of neighbouring residential and other adjoining properties and the character of the area in compliance with policies OE1 and S6 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan Saved Policies 2007.
The development hereby approved shall be serviced by no less than one accessible parking bay designed to accord with BS 8300-1:2018.
REASON:
To ensure that older and disabled people are afforded access to the full range of marketing in accordance with the London Plan (2021)

The development hereby approved shall ensure that access for disabled people, including wheelchair users, is provided via a suitably wide entrance doorway, a level threshold, with all internal facilities constructed in accordance with Approved Document M to the Building Regulations 2010 (2015 edition).
REASON:
To ensure that older and disabled people are afforded access to the full range of marketing in accordance with the London Plan (2021)

The proposed drainage for the temporary marketing suite shall be in full accordance with the overall drainage strategy for the site and each relevant residential phase to be agreed with the Local Planning Authority and formally discharged under Condition 4 of the extant planning permission reference: 1331/APP/2017/1883.

The applicant is reminded that the temporary car parking which is in place at present on the western side of the access road and not associated to the Marketing Suite does not benefit from consent.  As such a revised temporary parking plan is required to re-discharge condition 21 of planning consent ref:1331/APP/2019/1666
